Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming.
I could tell that the people working behind-the-scenes really cared about their film. They may not be professionals by trade or degree (possibly possible), but they went above and beyond to make a wonderful short film.
The story is compacted in just under 8 minutes. No complaints there from me though because what took

I'd even say some shades of Hitchcock...this is clearly better than MMM, which is seen as a guilty pleasure by some if not most Woody fans.
Takes what it means to be human and stretches the imagination to do it.
Truly a John Ford classic!

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was remade as the 1979 American film "Love You, Love You Not." It tells the story of couple of young good looking boys named Patrice and Michel. No wonder a lot of girls went crazy over them and both were involved in several relationships involving girls
